sentences: Daniel Moore (born 1941 in Walla Walla, Washington, U.S.) is an American musician, singer and songwriter.
Moore also wrote the song "Shambala", a song which was a hit for both B. W. Stevenson and Three Dog Night that same year.
In late 1975, he contributed backing vocals for the tracks on Bo Diddley's The 20th Anniversary of Rock 'n' Roll all-star album.
Moore currently runs his own record label, DJM Records.
